subject: p15131736
History: Year old woman with COPD, Tachypnea in setting of COPD.
Findings: Lung volumes are low with secondary crowding of the bronchovascular markings. There is however superimposed pulmonary edema which may have progressed since prior although changes could in part be to lower lung volumes. Enlargement of the cardiac silhouette is also noted, again not significantly changed. More dense left basilar opacity, particularly on the frontal view could be combination of atelectasis noting that infection is difficult to exclude.
Impression: Cardiomegaly and pulmonary edema which may have progressed since prior although some changes may be accounted for by lower lung volumes on the current exam. Left basilar opacity, potentially atelectasis noting that infection would also be possible.
